teetime.framework

Class AnalysisConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • teetime.framework.AnalysisConfiguration
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractCompositeStage

    public abstract class AnalysisConfiguration
extends Object
    Represents a configuration of connected stages, which is needed to run a analysis. Stages can be added by executing addThreadableStage(Stage).

      • addThreadableStage

        protected final void addThreadableStage(Stage stage)
        Execute this method, to add a stage to the configuration, which should be executed in a own thread.
        Parameters:
        stage - A arbitrary stage, which will be added to the configuration and executed in a thread.

      • addThreadableStage

        protected final void addThreadableStage(AbstractCompositeStage stage)
        Execute this method, to add a CompositeStage to the configuration, which should be executed in a own thread.
        Parameters:
        stage - A arbitrary CompositeStage, which will be added to the configuration and executed in a thread.

protected static <T> IPipe connectIntraThreads(OutputPort<? extends T> sourcePort,

        Connects two stages with a pipe within the same thread.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of elements to be sent
        Parameters:
        sourcePort - OutputPort of the sending stage
        targetPort - InputPort of the sending stage
        Returns:
        the pipe instance which connects the two given stages

      • connectPorts

        protected final <T> void connectPorts(OutputPort<? extends T> sourcePort,
                                      InputPort<T> targetPort)
        Connects two ports with a pipe with a default capacity of currently 4
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of elements to be sent
        Parameters:
        sourcePort - OutputPort of the sending stage
        targetPort - InputPort of the sending stage

      • connectPorts

        protected final <T> void connectPorts(OutputPort<? extends T> sourcePort,
                                      InputPort<T> targetPort,
                                      int capacity)
        Connects to ports with a pipe of a certain capacity
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of elements to be sent
        Parameters:
        sourcePort - OutputPort of the sending stage
        targetPort - InputPort of the sending stage
        capacity - the pipe is set to this capacity, if the value is greater than 0. If it is 0, than the pipe is unbounded, thus growing of the pipe is enabled.
